title: Multiple Select Q24 Punctuation Multiple Select
prompt: Which two sentences contain errors in punctuation?
feedback:
One sentence with an error is: “I am confident that through my coursework, I have mastered a professional graphic designers’ technical skills.” The writer means the skills of one professional graphic designer. The word “designer” needs to be a possessive noun, so it should have an apostrophe and ‘s’ at the end. With the apostrophe after the ‘s,’ this means belonging to more than one designer.

The second sentence with an error is: “My instructors help has been invaluable to my development as an artist.” This sentence should have an apostrophe in the word “instructors.” If the writer means multiple instructors, this sentence should read: “My instructors’ help has been invaluable to my development as an artist.” If the writer means one instructor, it should read: “My instructor’s help has been invaluable to my development as an artist.”
